key_facts: Global sea ice hit a record low in February 2025.
Arctic sea ice reached its lowest February extent on record.
Antarctic sea ice recorded its fourth-lowest February extent.
A short-term Arctic heatwave contributed to the sea ice drop.
Climate change is a long-term driver of sea ice loss.
Reduced sea ice creates darker ocean surfaces.
Darker ocean surfaces absorb more sunlight.
February 2025 was the third hottest on record.
Recent months have exceeded 1.5°C above preindustrial levels.
Experts call for rapid reductions in greenhouse gas emissions.
Sea ice loss contributes to rising temperatures.
Sea ice loss contributes to rising sea levels.
Experts warn of worsening climate impacts.
The data emphasize the need for stronger global climate action.
